alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 12 at 6:29PM CST until January 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through just before sunrise Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, ending at 8 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions continue. Rip and north-to-south longshore currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High surf will rapidly improve later this evening as winds diminish and wave action subsides. High rip currents may continue a bit longer, but should also subside later tonight and eventually drop to low by Saturday.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline, or toward the shoreline in the direction of breaking waves.

area.areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island
